message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.SOC, cs.HC, cs.IR. 

The paper discusses a framework for routing tasks across and within online crowds, which involves indexing the topic-specific expertise and social features of the crowd contributors and using a routing algorithm to suggest the best sources to ask based on knowledge vs. availability trade-offs. This involves aspects of social computing (cs.SOC), human-computer interaction (cs.HC), information retrieval (cs.IR), and potentially also data mining (cs.SD) and social network analysis (cs.SI).
